name: The Courtyard at Lake Lucerne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was so friendly and genuine. Fantastic elegant breakfast, far beyond a continental breakfast! Great egg dish, strong coffee in dainty china cups, fresh fruit, high quality pastries. With the "summer special," of course you are not going to get the fancy Victorian rooms, but the Art Deco (which was roomy and comfortable, but not elegant or romantic). If elegance is what you want, spring for a specific room. Great location in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: First rate staff, excellent b-fast, urban setting

reviews.text: Ah to step back in time and be treated so elegantly! This B&B complex is a hidden jewel, breathtakingly beautiful and painstakenly cared for. How fortunate that someone how the intellegience to save these historic homes.
reviews.title: A Feast for the Soul !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are major highway ramps bordering the complex, but you soon forget them when you see the courtyard. However, with this location, you can walk to downtown and the Wall St. area, or take a free city shuttle.
reviews.title: Overall beauty, late night traffic noise

reviews.text: The rooms were expertly decorated, roomy and comfortable. The staff was very accomodating especially Maria who made our visit even friendlier.
reviews.title: Not as advertised

reviews.text: There is no pool, but you don't go there for a pool, but for the beauty of the place.
reviews.title: Not What We Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights 8 & 9 October and had a fabulous time. We stayed in one of two Victorian houses in the honeymoon suite. The room which was furnished with antiques was great and the bathroom spacious with a fabulous Victorian enamel bath. Original features abound. If you like sanitized contemporary corporate style accommodation this may not be the place for you. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We walked around the area during our stay and loved the area around Lake Eola. At night we walked to 'Spice' overlooking Lake Eola to eat (that was a great dining experience) and had a taxi back (because of rain not fear!). I thought the contrast between the modern surrounding area and the oasis that is The Courtyard was amazing. Stand back, take it all in and wonder at the advances made in the period between the two. Wonderful!
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

likes.liked: — Romantic period property with original features and antiques.

reviews.text: My stay at the courtyard was absolutely wonderful!
reviews.title: The Oasis of Orlando!!!

reviews.text: The grounds are really well conserve...the rooms are decorated with antiques , and the whole experience was amazing..the staff is amazing too!
reviews.title: Dump, Dump, Dump

reviews.text: It's a oasis in the middle of the city!
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding Location :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: s:
reviews.title: Don't Listen To Whiners, This B&B's A Gorgeous Steal.

reviews.text: I was in town for business and stayed at this property in the apartment style building. Overall I was disappointed with my room, but the property grew on me as my stay went on.
reviews.title: Disappointed, but could be worse

reviews.text: The kitchen feature was nice, and the living room was large. The furniture was not clean as the couch was covered in white specks. I did have the pleasure of encountering a cockroach, however this only happened once during my stay. The TV's are small, the air conditioning was loud. I came back one day and my a/c had been turned up to 90 degrees. The maid also left the door unlocked on more than one occassion. The bathroom had dirty grout, and the tubs faucets were corroded. There were days that I know the bathroom was not cleaned. The walls are paper thin and you hear your neighbors coming and going as well as conversations near by. There were weddings two nights that I was there and the music was extremely loud, although it does end by 10pm. However, when you book a room in a place that advertises outdoor weddings the music should be expected.
reviews.title: Quaint & Comfortable - who knew Orlando could be so lovely?

reviews.text: The highway ramp is literally in the front yard and does obstruct the view of the lake, but again when you book in a downtown establishment, some city features should be expected.
reviews.title: Finding Old Florida in Downtown Orlando

likes.disliked: — hum of traffic from 408 but it was not overwhelming

reviews.text: The continental breakfast left a little to be desired. However, I enjoyed eating breakfast in the warm Florida air each morning. I also enjoyed many evenings on the porch with a glass of wine. They give you a carafe of wine during your stay, and while it is not the best of quality, they give you a large quantity. My carafe lasted me several nights.
reviews.title: Misleading Advertising!

likes.disliked: — Close to I-4 and absolute lies website to actual experience

reviews.text: The gardens were smaller than I expected based on the advertising, and there were tons of small lizards that would scurry as you walked down the path.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

likes.liked: — the fact that we could walk to the wedding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Courtyard at Lake Lucerne is 3 historic properties next to each other--2 beautifully restored ornate inns flanking a classic Art Deco apartment building where most guests stay. Weddings are held at both inns throughout the weekend, so guests in the Art Deco building (the Welborn) are "treated" to music from both sides. Happily, the weddings end promptly at 10 pm. Another thing to know beforehand: there is no view of Lake Lucerne, as a freeway offramp separates the lake from the inns. Aside from that, it's a convenient location in downtown Orlando. Thumbs up for the breakfast that comes with the room--nice presentation and good variety. Although most rooms in the Welborn are suites with kitchenettes, ours did not have one, but management supplied an ice chest.
reviews.title: Nice but not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first experience at a B&B, and being a little tight on funds we decided to make The Courtyard our destination. We stayed in the Yellow Room in the Dr. Phillips House. It was my birthday weekend. We checked in a little before 3 and made our way to the room. The house was very elegantly decorated with antiques everywhere. When I opened the door to our room, it was decorated with Happy Birthday balloons, banners and streamers. Turns out, my fiancee called the manager and was able to come by the day before our stay to decorate our room and have a cake waiting for me. Our room had a door that opened directly to the large balcony that over looked the grounds. The next morning we enjoyed the variety of breakfast foods they had to offer, from french toast, bagels, cereals and so on. Before we knew it, it was time to check out. It was a blast. The staff was very nice and accomodating. Don't bother staying at the Wellborn, spend a little extra and stay in the Dr. Phillips house, it's worth it!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay at an Amazing B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here just after the new year. We don't have much money but decided to spend a bit more than the Motel 6 places we are used to and treat ourselves. And boy were we disappointed. We paid almost $150 for 1 night and got a Motel 6 type of room.
reviews.title: Not as Advertised - ok but Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The property - when you look online you are shown a photo of a huge victorian mansion surrounded by woods on a lake. In reality, there are several buildings that overtime became part of one hotel property. The I-4 is an elevated highway that nearly goes right over the property! And what's worse, an access ramp goes up to the I-4 about 20 feet from the hotel's front door! There is no view of the lake, as the highway ramp blocks it.
reviews.title: Beautiful, elegant b & b in the heart of Orlando!
Beautiful Gardens
reviews.text: 2. The buildings - you don't get to stay in the gorgeous victorian mansion pictured on the web site. You get to stay in the dumpy "art deco" apartments next door. Filthy, run down, plastic WalMart blinds in windows, cheap furniture. We were really disappointed that we got this room. It was basically a Motel 6 if not worse. Thats why we were so upset. You pay money for a victorian mansion and get a dump instead. In all the photos online they have basically cropped the images so you don't see the real property. These are old apartments nurses used to live in who worked at the hospital next door.

aka: The Courtyard At Lake Lucerne Hotel
